stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators module¶

Defines energy calculators.

See energy.

class stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyCalculator(use_cache=False)¶

Bases: object

Calculate the energy of molecules.

cache¶

A dict hodling calculated energy values of the form

cache = {
    (mol1, conformer1): 12.2,
    (mol1, conformer2): 2.0,
    (mol2, conformer2): 321.12
}

which holds every Molecule and conformer whose energy was calculated by the EnergyCalculator. Here mol1 and mol2 are Molecule objects and conformer1 and conformer2 are of type int, and are the ids of the conformers passed to energy().

Type:dict
use_cache¶

If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer, but will instead return the previously calculated value.

Type:bool
__init__(use_cache=False)¶

Initializes a EnergyCalculator instance.

Parameters:use_cache (bool, optional) – If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer, but will instead return the previously calculated value.
energy(mol, conformer=-1)¶

Calculates the energy of mol.

Parameters:
  • mol (Molecule) – The Molecule whose energy is to be calculated.
  • conformer (int, optinal) – The conformer of mol to use.
Returns:

The energy.
Return type:

float
exception stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyError¶

class stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.FormationEnergy(energy_calculator, reactants, products, reactant_conformers=None, product_conformers=None, use_cache=False)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyCalculator

Calculates the formation energy of a molecule.

energy_calculator¶

The EnergyCalculator used to calculate the energy of all reactant and product molecules.

Type:EnergyCalculator
reactants¶

The reactants. If there are multiples of the same reactant then it must appear multiple times in this list.

Type:list of Molecule
products¶

The molecules which are produced as a result of the formation reaction. This list must omit the Molecule passed to energy(). If there are multiples of the same product, it must appear multiple times in this list.

Type:list of Molecule
reactant_conformers¶

The conformer ids of the molecules in reactants to use.

Type:list of int
product_conformers¶

The conformer ids of the molecules in products to use.

Type:list of int

Examples

# Make the molecules needed to calculate formation energy.
water = StructUnit.smiles_init('[H]O[H]')
bb1 = StructUnit2(...)
bb2 = StructUnit3(...)
cage = Cage([bb1, bb2], FourPlusSix())

# Make the energy calculator used to calculate energies.
uff_energy = UFFEnergy()

# Make the formation energy calculator.
formation = FormationEnergy(
    energy_calculator=uff_energy,
    reactants=[bb1]*6 + [bb2]*4,
    products=[water]*cage.topology.bonds_made
)

# Calculate the formation energy.
formation_energy = formation.energy(cage)
__init__(energy_calculator, reactants, products, reactant_conformers=None, product_conformers=None, use_cache=False)¶

Initializes a FormationEnergy instance.

Parameters:
  • energy_calculator (EnergyCalculator) – The EnergyCalculator used to calculate the energy of all reactant and product molecules.
  • reactants (list of Molecule) – The reactants. If there are multiples of the same reactant then it must appear multiple times in this list.
  • products (list of Molecule) – The molecules which are produced as a result of the formation reaction. This list must omit the Molecule passed to energy(). If there are multiples of the same product, it must appear multiple times in this list.
  • reactant_conformers (list of int, optional) – The conformer ids of the molecules in reactants to use.
  • product_conformers (list of int, optional) – The conformer ids of the molecules in products to use.
  • use_cache (bool, optional) – If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer, but will instead return the previously calculated value.
energy(mol, conformer=-1)¶

Calculates the formation energy of mol.

Parameters:
  • mol (Molecule) – The Molecule whose formation energy is to be calculated.
  • conformer (int, optinal) – The conformer of mol to use.
Returns:

The formation energy.
Return type:

float
class stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.MMFFEnergy(use_cache=False)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyCalculator

Uses the MMFF force field to calculate energies.

Examples

# Create a molecules whose energy we want to know.
mol1 = StructUnit.smiles_init('CCCNCCCN')
mol2 = Polymer(...)
mol3 = Cage(...)

# Create the energy calculator.
mmff = MMFFEnergy()

# Calculate the energies.
energy1 = mmff.energy(mol1)
energy2 = mmff.energy(mol2)
energy3 = mmff.energy(mol3)

class stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.XTBEnergy(xtb_path, gfn_version=2, output_dir=None, num_cores=1, calculate_free_energy=False, electronic_temperature=300, solvent=None, solvent_grid='normal', charge=0, num_unpaired_electrons=0, unlimited_memory=False, use_cache=False)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators.EnergyCalculator

Uses GFN-xTB to calculate energy and other properties.

By default, energy() will extract other properties of the Molecule and conformer passed to energy(), which will be saved in the attributes of XTBEnergy.

Notes

When running energy(), this calculator changes the present working directory with os.chdir(). The original working directory will be restored even if an error is raised, so unless multi-threading is being used this implementation detail should not matter.

If multi-threading is being used an error could occur if two different threads need to know about the current working directory as XTBEnergy can change it from under them.

Note that this does not have any impact on multi-processing, which should always be safe.

xtb_path¶

The path to the xTB executable.

Type:str
gfn_version¶

Parameterization of GFN to use in xTB. For details see https://xtb-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/basics.html.

Type:str
output_dir¶

The name of the directory into which files generated during the calculation are written, if None then uuid.uuid4() is used.

Type:str
num_cores¶

The number of cores xTB should use.

Type:str
calculate_free_energy¶

Whether to calculate the total free energy and vibrational frequencies. Setting this to True can drastically increase calculation time and memory requirements.

Type:bool
electronic_temperature¶

Electronic temperature in Kelvin.

Type:str
solvent¶

Solvent to use in GBSA implicit solvation method. For details see https://xtb-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/gbsa.html.

Type:str
solvent_grid¶

Grid level to use in SASA calculations for GBSA implicit solvent. Can be one of 'normal', 'tight', 'verytight' or 'extreme'. For details see https://xtb-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/gbsa.html.

Type:str
charge¶

Formal molecular charge.

Type:str
num_unpaired_electrons¶

Number of unpaired electrons.

Type:str
unlimited_memory¶

If True energy() will be run without constraints on the stack size. If memory issues are encountered, this should be True, however this may raise issues on clusters.

Type:
class:bool
total_energies¶

dict of the total energy of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
homo_lumo_gaps¶

dict of the HOMO-LUMO gap of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
fermi_levels¶

dict of the Fermi level of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
homo_lumo_orbitals¶

dict of the HOMO-LUMO orbital properties of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
qonly_dipole_moments¶

dict of the q only dipole moment of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
full_dipole_moments¶

dict of the full dipole moment of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
qonly_quadrupole_moments¶

dict of the q only quadrupole moment of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
qdip_quadrupole_moments¶

dict of the q+dip quadrupole moment of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
full_quadrupole_moments¶

dict of the full quadrupole moment of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer).

Type:dict
total_free_energies¶

dict of the total free energy of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer). This is empty if calculate_free_energy is False.

Type:dict
frequencies¶

dict of the vibrational frequencies of each Molecule and conformer passed to energy(). The key has the form (mol, conformer). This is empty if calculate_free_energy is False.

Type:dict

Examples

bb1 = StructUnit2.smiles_init('NCCNCCN', ['amine'])
bb2 = StructUnit2.smiles_init('O=CCCC=O', ['aldehyde'])
polymer = Polymer([bb1, bb2], Linear("AB", [0, 0], 3))
conformer = 0

# Optimize the constructed molecule so that it has a
# reasonable structure.
optimizer = OptimizerSequence(
    ETKDG(),
    XTB(xtb_path='/opt/gfnxtb/xtb', unlimited_memory=True)
)
optimizer.optimize(polymer)

# Calculate energy using GFN-xTB.
xtb = XTBEnergy(
    xtb_path='/opt/gfnxtb/xtb',
    unlimited_memory=True
)

p_total_energy = xtb.energy(polymer, conformer)

# Extract properties from the energy calculator for a given
# molecule and conformer.
key = (polymer, conformer)
p_homo_lumo_gap = xtb.homo_lumo_gaps[key]
p_fermi_levels = xtb.fermi_levels[key]
p_homo_lumo_orbitals = xtb.homo_lumo_orbitals[key]
p_full_dipole_moments = xtb.full_dipole_moments[key]
p_full_quadrupole_moments = xtb.full_quadrupole_moments[key]

# The total energy can be extracted at any point from the
# calculator.
polymer_total_energy = xtb.total_energies[key]

If calculate_free_energy is True, xTB performs a numerical Hessian calculation and calculates the total free energy and vibrational frequencies of a molecule. It is recommended that a well optimized structure be used as input for these calculations.

# Optimize the constructed molecule so that it has a
# reasonable structure.
optimizer = OptimizerSequence(
    ETKDG(),
    XTB(
        xtb_path='/opt/gfnxtb/xtb',
        unlimited_memory=True,
        opt_level='verytight'
    )
)
optimizer.optimize(polymer)

# Calculate energy using GFN-xTB.
xtb = XTBEnergy(
    xtb_path='/opt/gfnxtb/xtb',
    unlimited_memory=True,
    calculate_free_energy=True
)

p_total_energy = xtb.energy(polymer, conformer)

# Extract properties from the energy calculator for a given
# molecule and conformer.
key = (polymer, conformer)
p_total_free_energy = xtb.total_energies[key]
p_frequencies = xtb.frequencies[key]

See also

  1. https://xtb-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/setup.html
__init__(xtb_path, gfn_version=2, output_dir=None, num_cores=1, calculate_free_energy=False, electronic_temperature=300, solvent=None, solvent_grid='normal', charge=0, num_unpaired_electrons=0, unlimited_memory=False, use_cache=False)¶

Initializes a XTBEnergy instance.

Parameters:
  • xtb_path (str) – The path to the xTB executable.
  • gfn_version (int, optional) – Parameterization of GFN to use in xTB. For details see https://xtb-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/basics.html.
  • output_dir (str, optional) – The name of the directory into which files generated during the calculation are written, if None then uuid.uuid4() is used.
  • num_cores (int, optional) – The number of cores xTB should use.
  • calculate_free_energy (bool, optional) – Whether to calculate the total free energy and vibrational frequencies. Setting this to True can drastically increase calculation time and memory requirements.
  • electronic_temperature (int, optional) – Electronic temperature in Kelvin.
  • solvent (str, optional) – Solvent to use in GBSA implicit solvation method. For details see https://xtb-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/gbsa.html.
  • solvent_grid (str, optional) – Grid level to use in SASA calculations for GBSA implicit solvent. Can be one of 'normal', 'tight', 'verytight' or 'extreme'. For details see https://xtb-docs.readthedocs.io/en/latest/gbsa.html.
  • charge (int, optional) – Formal molecular charge.
  • num_unpaired_electrons (int, optional) – Number of unpaired electrons.
  • unlimited_memory – If True energy() will be run without constraints on the stack size. If memory issues are encountered, this should be True, however this may raise issues on clusters.
  • use_cache (bool, optional) – If True energy() will not run twice on the same molecule and conformer.
_get_properties(mol, conformer, output_file)¶

Extracts properties from a GFN-xTB energy calculation.

Parameters:
  • mol (Molecule) – The Molecule whose energy was calculated.
  • conformer (int) – The conformer of mol to use.
  • output_file – Name of the output file with xTB results.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
_run_xtb(xyz, out_file)¶

Runs GFN-xTB.

Parameters:
  • xyz (str) – The name of the input structure .xyz file.
  • out_file (str) – The name of output file with xTB results.
Returns:

None
Return type:

NoneType
energy(mol, conformer=-1)¶

Calculates the energy of mol using xTB.

Parameters:
  • mol (Molecule) – The Molecule whose energy is to be calculated.
  • conformer (int, optional) – The conformer of mol to use.
Returns:

The energy.
Return type:

float
stk.calculators.energy.energy_calculators._add_cache_use(energy)¶

Makes energy() use the cache.

Decorates energy so that before running it checks if the Molecule and conformer have already had their energy calculated. If so, and use_cache is True, then the energy value in the cache is returned.

Parameters:energy (function) – A function which is to have cache use added to it.
Returns:The decorated function.
Return type:function
